study_identification.title: Characterizing the distinct imaging phenotypes, clinical behavior, and genetic vulnerability of brain maturational subtypes in mood disorders

study_characteristics.study_objective: To map individual-level regional GMV deviations via quantile normative modeling in mood disorders (MDD, BD), identify maturational subtypes, and characterize differences in clinical behavior, transcriptomics, and genetic risk; with replication in an independent medicated patient cohort.

dataset_name.Answer: Single-site clinical cohort (First Affiliated Hospital of China Medical University, Shenyang)
dataset_name.Reason: Participants were recruited and scanned at a single hospital site; MRI acquisition specifies one 3T GE system at the same institution.
dataset_name.Supporting Text: Structural MRI scanning was conducted on a Signa HDx 3.0 T ... at the First Affiliated Hospital of China Medical University. Patients and HC were recruited ... at the First Affiliated Hospital of China Medical University.
dataset_name.Page/Line: Main PDF: Methods and materials – Participants & Image acquisition; lines 67–79, 100–108

hc_n.Reason: Supplementary Table S1 lists HC N=404 used to derive normative charts.
hc_n.Supporting Text: Dataset 1 Clinical and Demographic Data | HC N=404

hc_age.Reason: Supplementary Table S1 provides HC age statistics (mean±SD).

hc_sex.Reason: Sex counts are provided for HC; percentages computed from N=404.

imaging_modality.Reason: T1-weighted images were acquired and used for VBM/GMV analyses.
imaging_modality.Supporting Text: T1-weighted images were acquired by using the three-dimensional fast spoiled gradient-echo sequence...

analysis_level.Reason: Normative deviations were computed per brain region; region names (e.g., caudalanteriorcingulate, parsorbitalis) correspond to Desikan–Killiany ROIs.
analysis_level.Supporting Text: We applied regional gray matter volumes (GMV)... Top 10 regions name: caudalanteriorcingulate, lateralorbitofrontal, parsorbitalis...
analysis_level.Page/Line: Main PDF: Methods – GMV normative deviation; lines ~80–100. Supplementary PDF: Table S9–S10, lines 190–230

preprocessing_pipeline.Answer: SPM12; CAT12; VBM with DARTEL normalization to MNI IXI555; tissue segmentation; bias correction; modulated GMV; TIV covariate
preprocessing_pipeline.Reason: Supplement details the CAT12/SPM12 VBM workflow, DARTEL to IXI555, and use of TIV as covariate.
preprocessing_pipeline.Supporting Text: CAT12 implemented in SPM12 for VBM... normalized into standard MNI IXI555 space... modulated by the Jacobian... TIV ... used as a covariate.

quality_checking.Reason: Automated CAT12 IQR-based QC with explicit pass/fail thresholds was applied.
quality_checking.Supporting Text: The quality of images was assessed by ... IQR ... An image was classified as to fail QC if it had a noise grade ≤ 'C' (70%) and a total IQR grade < 'B' (80%). We applied the cut-off (>=80%, >= grad B)...

quality_checking_detail.Answer: CAT12 IQR-based QC; fail if noise grade ≤ C (70%) and total IQR < B (80%); applied cutoff ≥80% (≥ grade B) to retain high-quality images.
quality_checking_detail.Reason: QC thresholds and criteria are explicitly described; exclusion counts not reported.
quality_checking_detail.Supporting Text: fail QC if ... noise grade ≤ 'C' (70%) and total IQR grade < 'B' (80%); applied the cut-off (>=80%, >= grad B) to ensure high quality images.

site_effect_handling.Reason: Single-site acquisition on one 3T GE scanner; no multi-site harmonization reported or required.
site_effect_handling.Supporting Text: Structural MRI scanning was conducted on a Signa HDx 3.0 T ... at the First Affiliated Hospital of China Medical University.

site_effect_detail.Answer: Single-site study (one scanner); no batch/site harmonization. Age and sex handled in normative step.
site_effect_detail.Reason: No mention of ComBat/HBR; consistent single-site design.
site_effect_detail.Supporting Text: ... conducted on a Signa HDx 3.0 T ... First Affiliated Hospital ...

model_origin.Reason: Norms were derived from the study's own HC cohort using quantile regression; not a pre-trained external model.
model_origin.Supporting Text: Quantile regression was used to obtain a normative range ... based on HC ...
model_origin.Page/Line: Main PDF: GMV normative deviation calculation, lines ~80–95

model_origin_detail.Reason: Model is newly trained on in-study controls; no external pre-training.
model_origin_detail.Supporting Text: We positioned individuals ... on the normative percentile charts based on HC ...
model_origin_detail.Page/Line: Main PDF: GMV normative deviation calculation, lines ~80–95

modeling_method.Answer: Quantile Regression (age- and sex-adjusted normative percentiles; z5, z50, z95)
modeling_method.Reason: Methods explicitly state use of quantile regression to generate normative percentile charts and compute deviation z-scores.
modeling_method.Supporting Text: Quantile regression was used to obtain a normative range ... expressed ... z5, z50, z95 ... as individual deviation z-scores for each brain region.
modeling_method.Page/Line: Main PDF: GMV normative deviation calculation, lines ~80–100

software_tool.Reason: No software/library is specified for the quantile regression normative modeling (e.g., R quantreg/Python not stated).
software_tool.Supporting Text: (No explicit software mentioned for quantile regression.)

response_variable.Answer: Regional gray matter volume (GMV) across cortical Desikan–Killiany ROIs
response_variable.Reason: Normative deviations computed for brain regions; listed regions match DK atlas nomenclature.
response_variable.Supporting Text: We applied regional gray matter volumes (GMV) ... Top 10 regions name ... caudalanteriorcingulate, parsorbitalis ...
response_variable.Page/Line: Main PDF: Methods; Supplementary: Tables S9–S10, lines 190–230

predictor_variables.Reason: Quantile regression modeled GMV as a function of age and sex as per method description and citation.
predictor_variables.Supporting Text: Quantile regression was used to obtain a normative range of regional GMV variation as a function of age and sex ...
predictor_variables.Page/Line: Main PDF: GMV normative deviation calculation, lines ~80–90

predictor_effects.Answer: Age and Sex modeled as fixed effects within quantile regression; no random/site effects (single-site).
predictor_effects.Reason: Quantile regression specification mentions age/sex; random effects not applicable in single-site design; no explicit random-effect model described.
predictor_effects.Supporting Text: ... variation as a function of age and sex ...
predictor_effects.Page/Line: Main PDF: GMV normative deviation calculation, lines ~80–90

nm_vldtn_handle_ns.Answer: Handled age and sex via quantile regression; applied CAT12 IQR-based QC thresholds; single-site acquisition implies no site/scanner batch effects modeled.
nm_vldtn_handle_ns.Reason: The study models key nuisance factors age/sex and enforces imaging QC; no mention of heteroscedastic variance modeling or site terms (single-site).
nm_vldtn_handle_ns.Supporting Text: Quantile regression ... as a function of age and sex ...; The quality of images was assessed by ... IQR ... applied the cut-off (>=80%, >= grad B).
nm_vldtn_handle_ns.Page/Line: Main PDF: GMV normative deviation calculation; Supplementary: QC lines 33–36

nm_vldtn_same_domain_nonindep.Reason: No explicit within-cohort cross-validation metrics (e.g., EV, MSLL, R) for the normative model are reported; cross-validation described pertains to clustering stability, not normative model fit.
nm_vldtn_same_domain_nonindep.Supporting Text: Clustering ARI cross-validation is reported; normative model accuracy metrics are not reported.
nm_vldtn_same_domain_nonindep.Page/Line: Supplementary PDF: Figure S3 (clustering ARI); normative model validation metrics NR

nm_vldtn_same_domain_indep.Reason: Replication in an independent medicated patient cohort using the same normative reference; regional deviation maps correlate between discovery and replication cohorts.
nm_vldtn_same_domain_indep.Supporting Text: We also validated the GMV deviations based subtyping analysis in a replication cohort ... correlations between dataset 1 and dataset 2 in subtype 1 (r=0.29, p<0.05) and subtype 2 (r=0.45, p<0.0001).
nm_vldtn_same_domain_indep.Page/Line: Main PDF: Abstract/Methods; Supplementary PDF: Figure S4 caption, lines 263–265

nm_vldtn_diff_domain.Reason: No external multi-site or different-scanner dataset was used to validate normative deviations.
nm_vldtn_diff_domain.Supporting Text: All data were acquired at the same hospital site; no other dataset used for external validation.
nm_vldtn_diff_domain.Page/Line: Main/Supplementary: Image acquisition states single site; external validation NR

clinical_application_and_analysis.clinical_dataset: First Affiliated Hospital of China Medical University (Shenyang) – discovery (drug-naïve/drug-free) and replication (medicated) cohorts
clinical_application_and_analysis.clinical_groups_age: Discovery HC: 29.0±9.3; Patients (subtypes): Subtype1 29.1±11; Subtype2 27.1±9; Replication subtypes: Subtype1 29.20±8.89; Subtype2 28.45±9.47
clinical_application_and_analysis.clinical_groups_sex: Discovery HC M/F:160/244; Subtype1 M/F:35/77; Subtype2 M/F:22/40; Replication Subtype1 M/F:24/51; Subtype2 M/F:69/124
clinical_application_and_analysis.deviation_metric: Z-scores relative to age/sex conditional percentiles (z5, z50, z95); infra-normal (<5% CI), normal (within), supra-normal (>95% CI)
clinical_application_and_analysis.association_analysis: Between-subtype comparisons via t-tests (HAMD/HAMA/BPRS; WCST); hierarchical clustering (Ward's) with 10-fold CV and 1000 permutations (ARI); PLS linking regional deviations to AHBA gene expression with permutation and spherical rotation bootstraps; PRS (PRSice) for AD and MDD with variance explained; symptom network analysis across HAMD/HAMA/BPRS.
clinical_application_and_analysis.key_findings_brief: Two maturational subtypes emerged—supra-normal dominant with frontal/cingulate increases, cognitive impairment and higher AD genetic risk; infra-normal dominant with widespread decreases, more severe depression and higher MDD genetic risk; patterns replicated in an independent medicated cohort.
clinical_application_and_analysis.key_findings_detailed: Subtype 1 (n=112) showed increased GMV deviations in frontal/cingulate/primary motor cortices and worse WCST performance; higher PRS-AD than HC at multiple thresholds (explaining 4.2–5.9% variance) but not PRS-MDD. Subtype 2 (n=62) showed globally decreased GMV deviations, higher HAMD (20.08±7.5 vs 23.82±8.9; p=0.008), elevated PRS-MDD (10.8% variance explained) but not PRS-AD. Replication cohort (n=268) yielded correlated regional deviation patterns with discovery (Subtype 1 r=0.29, p<0.05; Subtype 2 r=0.45, p<0.0001).
clinical_application_and_analysis.key_limitations: Single-site cohort limits generalizability and precludes assessment of site/scanner batch effects; normative model performance metrics (e.g., EV/MSLL) not reported; software for quantile regression unspecified; ROI definition for deviations implied by region names but not explicitly described in preprocessing pipeline.
clinical_application_and_analysis.application_notes: Clustering stability assessed via 10-fold CV with 1000 permutations (ARI); deviations encoded as {-1,0,+1} and summarized by abnormality rate and extent; transcriptomics used DK68 left hemisphere mapping for AHBA alignment.

general_notes: Normative modeling follows Lv et al., 2021; regional labels are consistent with Desikan–Killiany atlas (e.g., parsopercularis, parstriangularis). QC via CAT12 IQR thresholds; TIV included as covariate in downstream analyses; no ComBat/HBR used due to single-site acquisition; PRS calculated via PRSice with PGC GWAS references.
